intro: Scaevola erosa, commonly known as the common海滨旋花, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Australia. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along the coast. Scaevola erosa is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
